summary: This is an email from attorney Avrom Robin to an unnamed recipient, likely a prosecutor, noting that the Epstein case has been assigned to the PCU (likely a specialized prosecution unit) and is now the recipient's case. The email suggests the recipient will receive superseding indictments and comments on the recipient's assignment to high-profile cases.

persons.name: Avrom Robin
persons.context: Author of the email, an attorney at the Law Offices of London & Robin in New York, who is informing the recipient about the Epstein case assignment.

persons.name: RMB
persons.context: Referred to as someone who 'keeps getting big cases'; likely a prosecutor or legal professional assigned to the Epstein case in the PCU.

connections.description: Avrom Robin is communicating with or about RMB regarding the assignment of the Epstein case to the PCU, indicating a professional legal network connection.

events.title: Email about Epstein case assignment
events.description: Avrom Robin sends an email noting the Epstein case is in the PCU and has been assigned to the recipient (likely RMB), with an expectation of superseding indictments.

keyFacts: The Epstein case was being handled by a specialized unit referred to as the 'PCU' as of July 2019.
The email recipient, likely a prosecutor referred to as 'RMB', was assigned to the case and could expect superseding indictments.
The correspondence suggests ongoing legal proceedings and case reassignments within the prosecution team handling Epstein.
